intro: Erica rigidula, commonly known as the rigid heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. This evergreen shrub typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in well-drained environments. Its small, bell-shaped flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, dark brown berries. Erica rigidula is often used in ornamental gardening due to its hardy nature and attractive appearance.
